page.title: 12QUILTING GROUP
page.content: Once the Quarry Centre had become established, a Quilting Group was started, working on alternate Thursday mornings in the Centre. This group of ladies make hand-sewn patchwork quilts, to their own designs, which are raffled for charities. In 1984 nearly 300 pounds was raised for the 'Old Folks' Club', which meets every Wednesday afternoon, in Goudhurst. This money ensures that the cost of the coach, which takes Kilndown members to the club, will be met. Another quilt was finished at the end of 1984 for the School P.T.A.. The raffle was drawn on Friday, 3rd. May, 1985, after a talk on local history by Gordon Batchelor, in the Globe & Rainbow. Betty, Gordon's wife, won the quilt. 190 pounds was raised to assist with the school swimming lessons. Other quilts are now being made.
